channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-11654] WAL Splitting dirs are not deleted after replay.
item.description:
I build a small cluster (20 nodes, several hundred regions) with hbase-0.98.4. And I found some splitting directories in /hbase/WALs/ today, which is very strange because those logs should have been replayed and deleted. Even though the ZK nodes of the dead RS had been deleted, these splitting directories still can cause a serious trouble for cluster restart. It resplitted and replayed all the splitting directories every time I restart my cluster, and cost a huge amount of time. Can't imagine what could happened if it's a cluster with hundreds of nodes and tens of thousands of regions.

Found 56 items
drwxr-xr-x - hadoop hadoop 0 2014-07-30 18:21 /hbase/WALs/hdpdev1.cm6.tbsite.net,60020,1406714828440-splitting

item.summary: WAL Splitting dirs are not deleted after replay.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
After debugging, I found that the master.MasterFileSystem misused the constructor of SplitLogManager. It used the constructor for tests, which omitted TaskFinisher, rather than the normal one.
So I made a small patch, and tested on my cluster. It works fine.
Besides, I didn't spend much time analysing the damaging influence of this bug. Maybe it can break the data consistency of hbase.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12659463/HBASE-11654.patch
against trunk revision .
ATTACHMENT ID: 12659463

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/10275//console

This message is automatically generated.

The SplitLogManager ctor MasterFileSystem calls is the following:


  public SplitLogManager(ZooKeeperWatcher zkw, final Configuration conf,

      Stoppable stopper, MasterServices master, ServerName serverName) 

      throws InterruptedIOException, KeeperException {

    this(zkw, conf, stopper, master, serverName, new TaskFinisher() {

      @Override

      public Status finish(ServerName workerName, String logfile) {

A TaskFinisher is instantiated.

Can you elaborate why the above is not enough ?

I was looking at master branch.

In 0.98, there is this ctor where null is used as TaskFinisher:


    public SplitLogManager(ZooKeeperWatcher zkw, final Configuration conf,

       Stoppable stopper, MasterServices master, ServerName serverName)

       throws InterruptedIOException, KeeperException {

    this(zkw, conf, stopper, master, serverName, false, null);
Yes, in 0.98.4, the MasterFileSystem calls the ctor of SplitLogManager with a null TaskFinisher.

nit: indentation is off


-          master, services, master.getServerName());

+ master, services,
Andrew Purtell: You want this in 0.98 ?
Thanks for bringing this to my attention. Let me test this 0.98 specific change locally and commit if things look good.

SUCCESS: Integrated in HBase-0.98 #434 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-0.98/434/)
HBASE-11654 WAL Splitting dirs are not deleted after replay (Victor Xu) (apurtell: rev c5da1cfafa9e5881c96a0e8d3a1532e714d4198c)

  • hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/master/MasterFileSystem.java

SUCCESS: Integrated in HBase-0.98-on-Hadoop-1.1 #409 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-0.98-on-Hadoop-1.1/409/)
HBASE-11654 WAL Splitting dirs are not deleted after replay (Victor Xu) (apurtell: rev c5da1cfafa9e5881c96a0e8d3a1532e714d4198c)

  • hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/master/MasterFileSystem.java

This issue was closed as part of a bulk closing operation on 2015-11-20. All issues that have been resolved and where all fixVersions have been released have been closed (following discussions on the mailing list).
